Intended Results: To highlight that the beef and suckler sectors in Ireland are primarily small scale farms operating at very low income levels. That this sector is the most exposed of all to the outcome of BREXIT due to its dependency on the UK market for 50% of its exports.::To highlight that the Government must be ready to provide immediate support to farmers if markets are disrupted in the coming days and months ahead. It is critical for the sector, that the shelf space which has been hard won in the major retailers in the UK is safeguarded for Irish product. A situation cannot be allowed arise where through market disruption or administrative delays that Irish beef loses any of this market share.::In addition, the EU market must function to support Irish and EU beef farmers. Current beef imports from Mercosur countries of circa 250,000t should be stopped immediately. This is consistent with the recent vote in the EU Parliament against ratification of the EU-Mercosur trade agreement.   In any on-going negotiations with third countries, EU market access for sensitive products must be off the table.

Congress writing to seek your urgent intervention and assistance in resolving a serious issue involving  a small group of vulnerable workers most of whom are employed by Rehab Enterprises in  Limerick.
Lobbying Activities: Emailed with an attached letter regarding the above subject|Email|1
